pages.text: All engineering begins with basic, mechanical motion. Kinetic energy is very useful on its own, and later it can be turned into electricity.$(br2)When it comes to kinetics, $(#808080)Ponder$()ing is your best friend. Hold W while hovering over a kinetic object to visualize how to use it.$(br2)$(pondernote)$()

Andesite Alloy is stuff of life for kinetic engineers. It is sturdy enough to make $(l:transporation/kinetic_transporation)shafts$(), which is one of three ways kinetic energy will be transferred. Once you craft a $(l:patchouli:workbench_and_blueprints)Engineer's Workbench and Engineer's Blueprint$(), you will be able to craft them for less material.

The humble Hand Crank may be your first source of kinetic energy. Be weary, however, as using it will quickly make you hungry. $(br)For a complete list of sources of kinetic energy, see $(l:patchouli:kinetic_generators)Kinetic Generators.
